Well there's something else. I hate to say it though, I guess I'll end up 
sounding like you lokking for mode everywhere =P. From what I made out, the 
way you're going, the battle won't stop until Blacknightmare dies. That, to 
me, is very abusive. There's no way you should decide that another player's 
char has no way to get out of a situation.

> > >before
> > > > > launching another large Chaochitan energy at Blacknightmare.
>For
> > >her
> > > > > there was no other escape from here except death, thus was the
> > >penalty
> > > > > for failing the test. Meanwhile Blight simply smirked at
>Darkfate
> > >and
> > > > > then turned and headed towards one of the walls.
> > > > >
> > > > > Blight: "They will work. Or you will die. As far as I can see
>its
> > >a
> > > > > win-win situation for me."
> > > > >
> > > > > With those words Blight walked through a new opening in the
>wall
> > >that
> > > > > sealed itself right back up after he left. He was now once
>again
> > >in
> > > > > the main control room of the complex, and soon a transmission
>was
> > > > > opened to all of Darkfate's troops, their frequency was also
> > > > > discovered when Blacknightmare was scanned. He chuckled
>somewhat
> > > > > before his message played over the comm lines of every single

> > > > > Blight: "This is Blight, of the Infecticons, your commander,

> > > > > is now our prisoner. If you do not do as we say, we shall kill

> > > > > You are all to stop with whatever you are doing and are to
>come
> > >to the

> > >from me
> > > > > then. If you need a landmark... just hover over the big

> > > > >

>Back
> > >in

> > > > > beneath her and sent her flying out of the chamber and back to

> > > > > and co. At that point the whirling water vortex greatly shrank
